bibl.title: The 'Other' in Second Temple Judaism. Essays in Honor of John J. Collins

bibl.seg: Robert A. Kugler, Dispelling an Illusion of Otherness? Juridical Practice in the Heracleopolis Papyri.

Daniel C. Harlow, Karina Martin Hogan, Matthew Goff & Joel S. Kaminsky (edd.), The 'Other' in Second Temple Judaism. Essays in Honor of John J. Collins = Calvin Institute of Christian Worship Liturgical Studies (Grand Rapids, MI, 2011) pp. 457-470.

While the Judeans of Heracleopolis drew heavily on the hybrid Greco-Egyptian common law of the Ptolemaic kingdom, they also relied on the juridical norms of their Judean ancestry to achieve their litigation goals.
